subject: RE: [junit] All tests run when trying to run one test
msgSnippet: We have the exact problem.  I was told it s a bug in Eclipse.  I sure hope they fix it soon, though!  Our workaround is to create a test suite for each test

We have the exact problem.  I was told it's a bug in Eclipse.  I sure
hope =
they fix it soon, though!  Our workaround is to create a test suite
for eac=
h test method, and then run that suite.  Yucky, but it works.


Todd.

I'm using JUnit4 inside Eclipse 3.2.2. When I tell it to run a sing=
le 
test, it will instead run all of the tests in the class up to and 
incl=
uding the one I want, but will only give the results of the one I 
specifie=
d. 

This is fine for my normal unit tests, but I also use JUnit for my 
in=
tegration tests, and some of those tests can take some time to 
complete. I=
f I choose to run a test that is physically near the bottom 
of the class, =
it can take minutes before it will run my test. 

Is there a way to really =
make it only run the one test you specify?
